Definition.WordDefinition:
Mope \Mope\, v. i. [imp. & p. p. {Moped}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Moping}.] [Cf. D. moppen to pout, Prov. G. muffen to sulk.] To be dull and spiritless; to spend time doing little; as, to mope around the house. ``Moping melancholy.'' --Milton. [1913 Webster]
A sickly part of one true sense Could not so mope. --Shak. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Mope \Mope\, v. t. To make spiritless and stupid. [Obs.] [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Mope \Mope\, n. A dull, spiritless person. --Burton. [1913 Webster]

mope n : someone who wastes time [syn: {dallier}, {dillydallier}, {dilly-dallier}, {lounger}] v 1: move around slowly and aimlessly [syn: {mope around}] 2: be apathetic, gloomy, or dazed [syn: {moon around}, {moon about}]
